text:
Wild guess: you have no IPv4 loopback address?

Please submit a truss of the Apache parent process while this is happening.

(truss -o outputfile -p process-id)

Thanks!
creator: trawick@apache.org

text:
Created attachment 5261
I have been seeing this for several months on fbsd 4.x too.
creator: pete@altadena.net

text:
This seems to happen on FreeBSD systems when you
run apache in jails and have not specified a 
specific ip address in the Listen directives in 
httpd.conf and ssl.conf

Please add your ip address to any Listen directives
in httpd.conf and ssl.conf

Change these
   Listen :80
   Listen :443
to these
   Listen  my.ip.ad.rs:80
   Listen  my.ip.ad.rs:443

This seems to be a problem resulting from the way ip's
and bind requests are mapped in the freebsd jail subsystem.

This is most propably not an apache problem.

Greetings
Christian
creator: ck@cksoft.de

text:
assuming that final explanation is correct; re-open if that explanation doesn't
help and problem still occurs on recent Apache 2
creator: trawick@apache.org
